meanings.definition: To separate items that were previously grouped together.
meanings.sent1: I am ungrouping the toys to put them back in their respective bins.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys ungrouping the different colored blocks and sorting them by size.
meanings.sent3: The toddler found ungrouping the puzzle pieces to be a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like ungrouping a tangled mess of thoughts after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick where he seemed to ungroup a deck of cards in the blink of an eye.

meanings.definition: The act of removing something from a group.
meanings.sent1: The ungrouping of the red apples from the basket was necessary for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: He observed the ungrouping of the students into smaller discussion groups.
meanings.sent3: The ungrouping of the noisy students from the quiet library was a relief.
meanings.sent4: The ungrouping of the stars in the night sky created a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The ungrouping of the ingredients made it easier to follow the recipe step by step.
